protocol.text: The obtained ATH1 chip and expression data (CEL files) were quality control checked, and evaluated using the Robin software package. RNA levels measured by high-throughput technique RNA microarray Affymetrix ATH1 and the probe-sets were redefined according to (Dai et al., 2005). The expression levels of probe sets were then estimated by GC-robust multi-array (GCRMA) analysis using R package gcrma. ID_REF =  VALUE = Log2 GCRMA value (expression level)

The cultures were induced by using a final concentration of 10 µM dexamethasone (DEX) per flask and further cultivated for the time course experiment. Cultures were harvested at indicated time points after induction (1, 3, 6, 9, 12, 24, 30, 48 h) and at time point zero (0). Uninduced cultures (DMSO instead of DEX) served as controls for each time point, and thus, 48 microarray analyses for 8 time points (3 biological reps) for +/- induced VND7-VP16-GR cultures, and 3 arrays for time 0h.

Arabidopsis thaliana plant lines (Col-0) that harbor a dexamethasone (DEX)-inducible pH35GVGR Gateway-based construct containing VND7-VP16-GR under the control of a 35S promoter were used. T3 seeds (~15-20 mg) were surface sterilized (10 min, 3% Na-hypochlorite) and washed five times with 1 ml of sterilized water each time. Seeds were added to 100 ml liquid MS medium supplemented with 1% sucrose (3.9 g/l Murashige & Skoog minerals including vitamins (Duchefa), adjusted with 0.45 g/l MES buffer and KOH to pH 5.7-5.8). Cultures were grown at 23°C for six days in the dark with 80 rpm in 250 ml flasks on a GFL 3017 shaker (GFL, Burgwedel, Germany).

Flasks were decanted over filter paper and washed 3 times with sterilized distilled H2O, dried on tissue paper, flash frozen, ball milled (Retsch 1-3 min, 30 Hz) and stored at -80°C until further use. Total RNA was isolated using RNeasy Kits (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) following the manufacturer's instruction.
Following fragmentation, 10 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 400.
GeneChips were scanned using the Hewlett-Packard GeneArray Scanner G2500A.
